body:
To resolve your issues, I want to know: Do you remove all existed plugins, we provided. Because I am not sure this caused your codes only, or the compatible issue between ours and your custom plugin.

And here is my guess:
1. You class is being enhanced more than once, for some reason I am not sure.
1. `#getSkyWalkingDynamicField` is a dynamic method generated by SkyWalking core. If you want to enhance class again(already enhanced once), please skip this method.
@ascrutae As a NPE, please fix it in 5.0.0

> You class is being enhanced more than once, for some reason I am not sure.

@suxiaoyong This is the key, I think.
#678 has been merged.

@michaelsembwever The season I didn't add license, is because the two examples don't include that, https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/trunk/NOTICE.txt and https://github.com/apache/tiles/blob/trunk/NOTICE.txt . 

But anyway, I have added them already. :)

As 2 PMC members(@wu-sheng @peng-yongsheng ) don't recommend sharing es. So sorry to say, we are not going to adjust this in official version. If you have these requirements, feel free the download source codes, and changes few codes. It is easy, to be honest.

Coverage decreased (-0.001%) to 23.077% when pulling **09b979c5af374a548b9ccbc4a6f08801bbce38bf on fix/sampling-service-npe** into **5319d72f3f36954cb87691e5aab744471909ee03 on master**.

not sure it is related or not, I found this NPE is caused by classcastexpcetion which the class EnhanceRequireObjectCache is loaded by multiple agent classloader which result in the spring native web request object cannot add to the enhanced class correctly which result in NPE.
Will this feature appear in 5.0?

@zone1511 This is an interesting found. Agent class loader should be 1:1 match the spring class loader. This should not be multi classloaders.  Can you provide the logs about `cannot add to the enhanced class correctly` ?
@zone1511 In 5.x , but not 5.0, I suppose.
@zone1511 This NPE caused by `EnhanceRequireObjectCache#nativeWebRequest` not init correctly.

If you want to contribute a plugin, we can discuss that. We will allocate you an available id  after you send the pull request.

 otherwise, choose  an  unused one  is OK.

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.skywalking.apm.agent.core.sampling.SamplingService.shutdown(SamplingService.java:85)
        at org.skywalking.apm.agent.core.boot.ServiceManager.shutdown(ServiceManager.java:51)
        at org.skywalking.apm.agent.SkyWalkingAgent$1.run(SkyWalkingAgent.java:66)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

@myoss This is not a startup fail. This is a shutdown exception, only. And it is no harm. Also, I have fixed it already in #691

非常感谢 采纳我提 "c/c++ 的 register关键字问题
但是 应用实例发现服务 proto/DiscoveryService.proto#L11-L12 中的
`service InstanceDiscoveryService {`
`rpc register (ApplicationInstance) returns (ApplicationInstanceMapping) { }`
`}`
还是有 register 关键字
以下是 github的链接
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-network/src/main/proto/DiscoveryService.proto

@songzhian Changing the service name will break things already built in the community. Although it should be fixed, please help us check, do other services have the compatible issues in C/C++?

FYI @peng-yongsheng

What is your meaning about multi agents in on box? which agents? 

And what is the box?
@jjtyro Look like you already know how to solve this. Can you send a pull request to fix this issue?

he means in single os, running multiple application which want to monitor by the skywalking agent. Any way to specify the agent application name from JVM argument instead of reading from agent config.

@wu-sheng I'm sorry to give you a reply so late!
 zone1511 has already expressed what I mean :)

The easy answer is **YES, you can**.

But you should be aware of these:
1. Follow this document(assume you need cn version) : [link](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/cn/Deploy-skywalking-agent-CN.md#高级特性) . You can use `-Dskywalking.*` to override any config in file as you wish.
1. When two application use the same agent folder, by default, your logs output into the same file. This is hard to read and understand, but these is a bug in this version(3.2.6) to override it. I already try to fix it, see #697.

So, that is why I just recommend use separated agent jars. OK?

BTW, I just change the issue title.

Hope these can help you.
Ok, I see. Thank you!
I can not reproduce the problem in my system,so I close the issure

Hi PMC,
  So the agent will read the config file related to its absolute location? In this way, we don't need to share one agent per machine and we can have many agent plus config plus log folder so each monitored application. As different agent may need to load different plugin for performance reason. If use same folder for multiple app. It is difficult to manage. 

Sent from my iPhone

> On 22 Dec 2017, at 3:26 PM, 吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> The easy answer is YES, you can.
> 
> But you should aware of these:
> 
> Follow this document(assume you need cn version) : link . You can use -Dskywalking.* to override any config in file as you wish.
> When two application use the same agent folder, by default, your logs output into the same file. This is hard to read and understand, but these is a bug in this version(3.2.6) to override it. I already try to fix it, see #697.
> So, that is why I just recommend use separated agent jars. OK?
> 
> BTW, I just change the issue title.
> 
> Hope these can help you.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>
@li-ya Thanks for your feedback.

> So the agent will read the config file related to its absolute location? In this way, we don't need to share one agent per machine and we can have many agent plus config plus log folder so each monitored application. As different agent may need to load different plugin for performance reason. If use same folder for multiple app. It is difficult to manage.

+1

@wengangJi This is not an error triggered by SkyWalking project. This depends on Google gRPC/Protobuf tools: `protoc`. So if you have any problem to run it, you should submit an issue in Protobuf or gRPC project.

I just can share with you about that, I can run this tool in my windows 7. Most of our known developers are using Mac OS.

@peng-yongsheng @hanahmily I did the following adjustments:
* `DurationItem` and `ThroughputItem` have been removed. Service defines must be explicit and clear. 
*  In server layer, AppServerInfo type represents the basic server info and related metrics
*  In service layer, ServiceInfo type represents the basic service info and related metrics
*  `getServiceSlowTrace` service has been provided by `queryBasicTraces` service. All trace query should be included in that.
